name: Api-rest-to-soap
tagline: API connectivity to SOAP Service. REST method to SOAP Service
body: ### API REST To SOAP Although both technologies are related to web services. Here you will find an implementation to accessing SOAP Services using an endpoint as a REST service. The main idea to use this kind of implementation is to maintain easily the accessibility SOAP services, which developers are commonly struggling to understand large numbers of XML tags, a structure of a tree with namespaces privately. In other words, this implementation of the REST service makes an understandable start of a point to use another service, which has been implemented in other technology, using JSON messages. ### What is JSON? Although it is not the goal to explain extensibly JSON and benefits about this language, below are the short definition to start; - JSON means JavaScript Object Notation, - It is open standard format and "human readable text to transmit data composed of attribute value-key pairs, - Related to the official Internet media type `application/json`, - It is an independent language using Javascript format but is text, - Extension file is `.json` ### SOAP Service concerning The chosen example for this API implemented is the SOAP Service - TShirt Service published in the following URL `http://tshirt-service.cloudhub.io/`. Its WSDL definition is [here](http://tshirt-service.cloudhub.io?wsdl). The SOAP Service is part of the extensive services published in the integration platform service in Mulesoft ([CloudHub](https://docs.mulesoft.com/runtime-manager/cloudhub)). Important information must a read if you are driven to implant a [Cloud Integration](https://docs.mulesoft.com/runtime-manager/cloudhub-faq). Feel free to swap the service you want to consume for that one you are interested in your organisation. ### Authors and Contributors Johnny Madrid (@johnnymadrid) is a GitHub user who is extending his technology acknowledge about API Integration between corporations using innovative and current technologies. Contact him if you are likely to collaborate in the project. ### Support or Contact Having trouble to download the project? Check out the documentation on GitHub [contributing to Open Source](https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/).
